014package org.jdbi.v3.core.statement;
015
016import java.util.ArrayList;
017import java.util.List;
018import java.util.Optional;
019import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
020import java.util.function.Function;
021
022import org.antlr.v4.runtime.CharStreams;
023import org.antlr.v4.runtime.Token;
024import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
025import org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.lexer.DefineStatementLexer;
026import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.internal.ErrorListener;
027
028import static org.antlr.v4.runtime.Recognizer.EOF;
029import static org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.lexer.DefineStatementLexer.COMMENT;
030import static org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.lexer.DefineStatementLexer.DEFINE;
031import static org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.lexer.DefineStatementLexer.DOUBLE_QUOTED_TEXT;
032import static org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.lexer.DefineStatementLexer.ESCAPED_TEXT;
033import static org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.lexer.DefineStatementLexer.LITERAL;
034import static org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.lexer.DefineStatementLexer.QUOTED_TEXT;
035
036/**
037 * Template engine which replaces angle-bracketed tokens like
038 * <code>&lt;name&gt;</code> with the string value of the named attribute.
039 * Attribute names may contain letters (a-z, A-Z), digits (0-9), or underscores
040 * (<code>_</code>).
041 */
042public class DefinedAttributeTemplateEngine implements TemplateEngine.Parsing {
043    @Override
044    public Optional<Function<StatementContext, String>> parse(String template, ConfigRegistry config) {
045        StringBuilder buf = new StringBuilder();
046        List<BiConsumer<StatementContext, StringBuilder>> preparation = new ArrayList<>();
047        Runnable pushBuf = () -> { // NOPMD
048            if (buf.length() > 0) {
049                String bit = buf.toString();
050                buf.setLength(0);
051                preparation.add((ctx, b) -> b.append(bit));
052            }
053        };
054        DefineStatementLexer lexer = new DefineStatementLexer(CharStreams.fromString(template));
055        lexer.addErrorListener(new ErrorListener());
056        Token t = lexer.nextToken();
057        while (t.getType() != EOF) {
058            switch (t.getType()) {
059            case COMMENT:
060            case LITERAL:
061            case QUOTED_TEXT:
062            case DOUBLE_QUOTED_TEXT:
063                buf.append(t.getText());
064                break;
065            case DEFINE:
066                pushBuf.run();
067                String text = t.getText();
068                String key = text.substring(1, text.length() - 1);
069                preparation.add((ctx, b) -> {
070                    Object value = ctx.getAttribute(key);
071                    if (value == null) {
072                        throw new UnableToCreateStatementException("Undefined attribute for token '" + text + "'", ctx);
073                    }
074                    b.append(value);
075                });
076                break;
077            case ESCAPED_TEXT:
078                buf.append(t.getText().substring(1));
079                break;
080            default:
081                break;
082            }
083            t = lexer.nextToken();
084        }
085        pushBuf.run();
086        return Optional.of(ctx -> {
087            try {
088                StringBuilder result = new StringBuilder();
089                preparation.forEach(a -> a.accept(ctx, result));
090                return result.toString();
091            } catch (RuntimeException e) {
092                throw new UnableToCreateStatementException("Error rendering SQL template: '" + template + "'", e, ctx);
093            }
094        });
095    }
096}
